p.codeblock: void OpenWithUrl(const char* url, uint64_t start_time, std::function<void(rte::Error* err)> cb)
public void openWithUrl(String url, long startTime, AsyncCallback callback)

section.p: This method supports opening live streaming media resources via URL. To speed up URL opening, you can call before this method to preload the resource. If the resource fails to open, you will receive the callback with the state kRtePlayerStateFailed. In this case, you need to call first, then call again to reopen the URL. If you have disabled autoplay, you can call after the resource is opened to start playback.

This method supports opening live streaming resources via URL. To speed up opening, you can preload the resource using before calling this method. If opening the resource fails, you will receive the callback with the player state as FAILED. In this case, you need to call first, then call again to reopen the resource. If you have disabled autoplay, you can call after the resource is opened to start playback.
section.note: This method currently supports URLs starting with rte://, CDN streaming URLs, and local media files.
This method currently only supports URLs starting with rte://, CDN streaming URLs, and local media files.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called after is initialized.
This method must be called after .

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback to report the player state as kRtePlayerStateOpening, indicating the URL is being opened. Once opened successfully, the player state is reported as kRtePlayerStateOpenCompleted.
After calling this method, the callback is triggered with the player state as OPENING, indicating the URL is being opened. Upon success, the player state changes to OPEN_COMPLETED.

plentry.pd: The URL to open. It can be a CDN streaming URL, a local media file, or a URL starting with rte://.
The playback start position in milliseconds.
Callback that asynchronously notifies the result of opening the URL resource. You can get the operation result or error code from the err parameter in the callback. See .
The URL to open. It can be a CDN streaming URL, a local media file, or a URL prefixed with rte://.
The start position of playback, in milliseconds.
Callback for asynchronously notifying the result of opening the URL resource. You can get error information through the method of this callback.
